abstract: Lenovo to buy IBM’s low-end server business. | Overseas banks may soon have to raise capital against potential losses for their American units. | A doctor displays faulty memory in SAC insider trading trial. | @GSElevator book to test the appetite for Wall Street exposés. | Icahn takes to Twitter.
snippet: Lenovo to buy IBM’s low-end server business. | Overseas banks may soon have to raise capital against potential losses for their American units. | A doctor displays faulty memory in SAC insider trading trial. | @GSElevator book to test the appetite...
lead_paragraph: Lenovo announced on Thursday that it would acquire IBM’s low-end server business for $2.3 billion, signaling the successful completion of a deal that fell through a year ago, Neil Gough and David Gelles write in DealBook. The server unit, which includes IBM’s x86 server business, brings in an estimated $5 billion in revenue a year.

headline.main: Lenovo in Deal for IBM’s Server Unit
